comments.body: They are still going to add the warden and skulk to the grimstone layer, It's already going to be dangerous as is, But I still agree since you can just build up the warden and ignore him.
This actually fits into Vanilla very well in my opinion. Also it should match the textures of grimstone so when you're looking into the caves you don't see it immediately
Good idea! Also maybe it could drop sand, allowing you to make TNT on the spot with it (also finally have renewable sand)
There is already dark oak mineshafts so I think they should use spruce instead
I doubt Mineshafts will be able to generate in the Deep Dark
we could use basalt for pillars and deepslate for platforms

First off, mineshafts look sick in the deep dark. Second, we already have dark oak mineshafts, so I agree with whoever said spruce. Also they shouldn't contain rarer loot in them because that would be super hard to code also the deep dark already has its own special loot
Maybe make stone pockets surround the ore in the grimstone too please, it looks weird and out of place.

Ideally I'd like to see a thick layer of andesite between the stone layer and the new blocks.  There is such a jarring difference in the textures when you put smooth vanilla stone right next to grimstone.

We see the same problem with Granite and Diorite but since they show up only in small blotches at the surface you don't notice it as much.

Ideally I'd like to also see Granite and Diorite caves in the Andesite layer to give large amounts of those building blocks . . . depending on how deep you went in the layer stone or grimstone could show up in blotches too. Really mix things up and make you feel like you are actually entering a new area as you keep going further down.

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360077103871-There-is-too-much-Grimstone-
this is virtually the same thing, but it has more votes.

it would be better if the transition was smoother. In the current snapshot, Grimstone starts appearing at Y=0 and by -8 it already is the only block generating. The transition should take longer before Grimstone is the only stone generating.

The ores that generate with Grimstone around them will eventually get a texture that matches that of Grimstone so that they look natural. Besides, I personally like the idea that when y becomes negative, you see Grimstone instead of normal stone. I think they could make Grimstone just a tiny bit lighter than how it is currently, but otherwise I think the concept and implementation is really cool.
I dont think that would leave enough room for the open caves...
I agree that it won't be enough room for REALLY big caves, but it can be medium cave still, and the normal stone caves above would be BIGGER. I agree it should be a better transition

HighestWriter93 I've looked at many caves in 21w07a, and most of the area where you'd find large caves is taken up by grimstone. There shouldn't be a problem with lowering the level it generates, or smoothing out the transition.

As of now, there defiantly needs to be improvements to the current texture of grimstone. As it stands out quite a bit and appears very abrasively in contrast to the current stone.

The addition of a middle ground variety of stone could be added to soften the current shift into grimstone. To act as a less jarring transition and help work as an indicator to players that there reaching the lower depths of the world.

- Quick tangent, the current indentation in the grimstone texture to me is off-putting. I know the depths of the world in these caves should stand apart from the surface and be seemingly unnatural, but they almost look like bricks!

I like the idea of a darker stone block and i love all the varients of grimstone however its too dark and too harsh there should be grimstone stone (which is smoother) and grimstone cobblestone {which is similar to the current grimstone texture) the texture over all should be softer and should be altered in order to fit in better with the stone textures. the grimstone should also be less frequent in order to make it more special. if this was the case you could even add grimstone quarries to mineshafts that spawn in grimstone areas these could be larger underground rooms with wooden support beams to hold up the stone above.

Honestly, I always thought this actually fit Minecraft, although It'd make a lot more sense If the Herobrine (which should be renamed "The other one", should be toggled In the world file, and be given the option to be given a selected skin) only Lived In small huts They build In caves, and that your actions essentially would affect the Herobrine's Morality, this could Include:

  • eating poisonous food (Negative Reaction)
  • killing the Herobrine once. (negative reaction)
  • killing the Herobrine's pets (Negative reaction)
  • stealing from the Herobrine (Negative reaction)
  • Giving The herobrine Useful materials (positive Reaction)
  • saving the Herobrine In a fight (Positive reaction)
  • helping the herobrine stay away from the warden (positive reaction)
Herobrine would probably be a great attack the player and their boss and everything that ever come and said
With Glowing Seagrass, or Glowing Mushrooms? I think this is a great idea. Since the Glow Squid won. I wish the Iceologer or Moobloom had won. But still a nice idea. :)

I still think that the items inside the bundles should be visible. On the other hand, certain items like enchantment books cost multiple things like books and emeralds, so maybe multiple items could be sold as well
Nice idea üëç
Thanks, and cranzag, that's a good idea.

it would make actually quite a lot of sense, as when copper is used to transmit voltages, if exposed to air, actually makes the corosion faster! therefor i would say, every time a lightning strikes the rod, it corodes by one stage
What do you wax it with
You wax it with honeycomb just like how you do with normal copper blocks.
But If they were to break or stop functioning once fully corroded, you would have incentive to go and find more copper.
There could be an iron lightning rod that can allow fire from lightning. The copper rod should not do this.

did you see that they emit the sound when hit with a projectile?

maybe some dispensers a lot of arrows and... then you dont have to worry about note blocks.
I was thinking the same thing
It should make different pitches of wind chimes.
We should also be able to throw the tomatoes like snowballs, and when hey fall they make a *splat* noise.
This would be funny
Players and mobs should get a short blindness effect when hit by a thrown tomato.
I've always liked the idea of a deep sea area in minecraft. it could have all kinds of new mobs!
I think the trench should have more magma block as usual.
Remember the original mob vote from back in 2017? The "giant squid" could be Mob A.
Good idea!! When I'm exploring the oceans of Minecraft, I feel that several things are missing there. It's not about having elements like corals or algae, it's more about having a maritime adventure.
they missed an opportunity, lets force them to take it
That's kinda sexist XD but yea this needs to happen, its so lazy that the azaleas have everything except their own wood type.
Good idea but would only be able to fit like 6 characters
Also green fire
You think outside the box, I really like this idea.

I think that copper lanterns are fantastic idea!

Also it's new use for copper ;D
I think 15 is maximum light level so I think it would also work if they made it like 8 to differentiate from the iron lanterns
Fun fact: Copper is an already planned ore. More fun facts: Amethyst is a planned mineral, but comes from Amethyst Geodes instead of as an ore. That's why just asking for more ores isn't productive.
I like more Ores and Geodes, just name some new ones then ones confirmed, just saying, not getting onto you though
I agree we need more ores in Minecraft
yes more ores! amethyst I think is added so is copper. But not opal, sapphire, and ruby not yet at least
I concur (agree)
i‚Äôd go like silver. Also bronze via iron and copper?
Purple Armor would be pretty rad. Besides, we already have Diamond Armor as a precedent for using crystals for armor

id say it would be a good split between chainmail and iron,

but crystals aren't very realistic for armour and tools, 

although it would be a very cool addition

Dude we got netherite and its a little op but if the amythist is an upgrade from netherite it would be way too op and would have no use exept to show off unless they add some kind of super powerfull mob in the game
it doesnt have to be stronger than diamond or netherite. It can be between other armors or just the same but have something special of it.

how the heck do you wear fragile crystals and call it armor? 

 

you're clearly a bedrock player because you seem weak minded
yeah i cans see this being done because it would be like mid waypoint between iron and diamonds
I want bedrock armor but you can get it in a command and creative mod too and iam In a bedrock player it can be in every edition ok
You saw the Phoenix Sc video to didn't you.
I was also gonna suggest this but saw yours and upvoted instead

that is actually a cool idea! but i think that aditional zoom wouldnt be THAT useful! therefor i would reccomend to using this, to zoom out with the spyglass. maybe add a little bit of additional zoom but not to much

This would be cool, except for mobile and xbox players who don't have a mouse, so for them, you could make it a slider, like in the settings for FOV, but on screen, inside the blocked screen area. maybe even make a box where you can type in a certain value.
I would really like this maybe if the image is to far away (if you zoom a lot) it would become difuse and you will have to focus so people will master the art of focusing and using the spyglass

406262811171 

Yes, the idea is that you can also use this to get less zoom if you think the default zoom is too much.

 

401023908072

Mobile players could use the 'expand' gesture, using two fingers to control their zoom. As for controller players, well I'm not sure, maybe they could use the left/right stick buttons? (L3, R3)
Smooth Amethyst would look great in builds. Maybe they could also be used to craft brick and chiseled varients, along with stairs and slabs!
Amethyst Crystals could be used to create Wind Chimes. Different materials could make different sounds
We need this, I think Purple Can go well with a lot of colors

Regular polished variant is nice. A variant I can think off from using this will be called either faceted or cut polished amethyst. The texture could look like it was polished further down to look like a faceted gemstone.
something similar to polished granite but amethyst
Been thinking this since the update. I've wanted a good purple block since I first started playing. Purpur is very magenta and pastel like, amethyst is perfect, just need a polished version
smooth, brick, chiseled, pillar.. pillar would be really great, it could somewhat mirror quartz designs, chiseled one could have note in them as music and tones seem to be quite related to amethyst
sounds fun
Do it it will bE so helpfull
Also neon bed to go with it
it's released? but anyways, it's spelt as 'Enchant'
Why do add mobs to the game
Released? How so is this released?
Iveo you
This should not be marked as released. There is still no such enchantment.
This isn‚Äôt released‚Ä¶

There is a way: Load a world on an older versions then update it to 1.18.

You reply: I play on Bedrock.

I reply: I do too. That's why I think older versions should be available on Bedrock Edition.

Also: I don't know why you'd want that. The terrain in 1.18 is highly varied and an upgrade in every sense from 1.17 terrain. Even most veterans absolutely love it because they're nostalgic about that type of terrain (Beta 1.8 used the same system, though of course it now looks way cooler).
im sure someone will make a datapack for the old generation

I hate the new Generation!

I wish I could play 1.18 without the Generator.

Unfortunately that's no longer possible because they took away the ability for biomes to dictate height and flatness, a thing old biomes heavily depended on. Relevant request: https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/4411066241805-Restore-scale-and-depth-parameters-in-biome-json-files
I definitely agree with you. I really hope Minecraft devs see this. I think they should keep old terrain but just scatter some new mountains every now and again

The old generation is outdated and the new one is a huge improvement. If you look at how clean it is vs older world generation it's hard to go back. If your device can't handle it that's kinda Mojangs fault for updating an outdated device. If only we could easily switch between versions. And btw, most of the playerbase can agree that this generation is better, however if you're not very experienced it might be a lot harder, and it does take away some of the simplicity of exploration in survival mode.
The old world generation should be an option just like the amplified world's used to be. The 1.18 update has made the world so large and treacherous it's overwhelming. I miss 1.17
I agree, i like the old generation more, there should be an option like amplified biomes to get the old generation back
i kinda miss the old world gen
I agree with this. It's just too big a change to be made without keeping the old system as an option. The new world height significantly harms performance, so it should be completely optional.

I have solution,
why we use old world type instead delete it, so when you generate world with this type, our world will be generated with old generation and old world limit, but the new structure still can generate but for Ancient City brobably will be more rare.

Yeah! I I also think it's worth giving players a choice between the old world generation and the new one, like "World Types" and make it like "Classic" like it was with the default textures. Plus, it's worth noting that not everyone still has enough powerful computers to process such worlds. Well, it's just a matter of taste -
play on new versions with the old generation of the world and caves.

If Mountain Villages are added, we can add some new Illagers to raids (like Mountaineer, Wind Caller and Iceologers in Minecraft Dungeons.) They can replace some Illagers to summon in raids. For example,  Mountaineer replace Vindicator, Iceologer replace Pillager. I think this is really cool!
I would love to cut your own patterns into the wood too, maybe you can make your own totem pole or something

the molten magma should slowly become lava again if it's placed above y = 0, but you can keep it by putting it in a cauldron, if the molten magma is in the caudron , you still take damage if you are close to it.
you reminded of cored lava
If molten magma is in the nether, then netherite items should still survive in it, if not that will defeat the whole point of netherite.
Lovely idea

If it's in the Nether than it shouldn't be very common down there,just not rare,and it wouldn't be in the big lava pools,otherwise netherite will just be a waste to use in the Nether. But it being below y=0 would be great as it would add a new challenge to deep underground,as well as make it more understandable about Minecraft having a core!ish...Corish. Since the world is infinite...

But I love this idea! Maybe Molten Magma would also with water create glowing magma,which would deal x2 the damage of normal magma and emit light too!

Future volcanologist here, and here's what I have to say:

 

PLEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEASE!!!

 

That's all I have to say. Thank you for suggesting this. :)

If it was used under y=0, make sure lava can still spawn naturally, for those looking for lava aquifers!
Nice idea but idk how many difficult it will be
probably not too difficult
Add a new layer of clouds at 256. The clouds are paper thin and wispy. Cirrus!
It would be cool if users could manipulate cloud height per chunk or something. Or that the cloud level bends.
They should make it so that you shouldn't be able to see the shape of clouds from the inside, which is very weird in my opinion.
